en: Introduction
O God, come to my assistance.
O Lord, make haste to help me.
Glory be to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Spirit,
as it was in the beginning, is now,
and will be for ever. Amen.
la: Gloria Patri et Filio et Spiritui Sancto,
sicut erat in principio, et nunc, et semper,

en: The Alleluia is omitted during Lent.
Examination of Conscience
In private prayers of compline, a moment for private examen is used. In communal prayer, a penitential prayer from the Missal can be used.
la: In orationibus privatis completorii, momentum pro examen privato usum fit. In orationibus communibus, oratio paenitentialis ex Missali usus fit.

en: Short Responsory
Into your hands, Lord, I commend my spirit.
Into your hands, Lord, I commend my spirit.
You have redeemed us, Lord God of truth.
I commend my spirit.
Glory be to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Spirit.
Into your hands, Lord, I commend my spirit.
la: In manus tuas, Domine, commendo spiritum meum.
In manus tuas, Domine, commendo spiritum meum.
Gloria Patri et Filio et Spiritui Sancto.
In manus tuas, Domine, commendo spiritum meum.

en: Canticle
Save us, Lord, while we are awake; protect us while we sleep; that we may keep watch with Christ and rest with him in peace.
la: Salva nos, Domine, vigilantes, custodi nos dormientes; ut vigilemus cum Christo et requiescamus in pace.

en: Save us, Lord, while we are awake; protect us while we sleep; that we may keep watch with Christ and rest with him in peace.
la: Salva nos, Domine, vigilantes, custodi nos dormientes; ut vigilemus cum Christo et requiescamus in pace.

en: At last, all-powerful Master,
you give leave to your servant to go in peace,
according to your promise.
For my eyes have seen your salvation
which you have prepared for all nations,
the light to enlighten the Gentiles
and give glory to Israel, your people.
Glory be to the Father and to the Son
and to the Holy Spirit,
as it was in the beginning,
is now, and ever shall be,
world without end. Amen.
la: quia viderunt oculi mei salutare tuum,
quod parasti ante faciem omnium populorum,

en: Master, now you are dismissing your servant in peace, according to your word; for my eyes have seen your salvation, which you have prepared in the presence of all peoples, a light for revelation to the Gentiles and for glory to your people Israel.
The Lord grant us a quiet night and a perfect death.
Amen.
la: Noctem quietam et finem perfectum concedat nobis Dominus omnipotens.

en: Loving Mother of the Redeemer
Loving mother of the Redeemer, gate of heaven, star of the sea,
assist your people who have fallen yet strive to rise again.
To the wonderment of nature you bore your Creator,
yet remained a virgin after as before.
You who received Gabriel's joyful greeting,
have pity on us poor sinners.
la: Alma Redemptóris Mater, quæ pérvia cæli
Porta manes, et stella maris, succúrre cadénti,
Súrgere qui curat pópulo: tu quæ genuísti,
Virgo prius ac postérius, Gabriélis ab ore

la.description: Traditional Gregorian chant for Alma Redemptoris Mater

en: Hail, Queen of Heaven
Hail, O Queen of Heaven, enthroned! Hail, by angels Mistress owned!
Root of Jesse, Gate of morn, when the world's true Light was born:
Glorious Virgin, joy to thee, loveliest whom in heaven they see:
Fairest thou where all are fair, plead with Christ our sins to spare.
la: Ave, Regina cælórum, Ave, Dómina Angelórum:
Salve, radix, salve, porta, Ex qua mundo lux est orta:
Gaude, Virgo gloriósa, Super omnes speciósa,
Vale, o valde decóra, Et pro nobis Christum exóra.

la.description: Traditional Gregorian chant for Ave Regina Caelorum

en: Queen of Heaven
Queen of Heaven, rejoice, alleluia:
For He whom you merited to bear, alleluia,
Has risen, as He said, alleluia.
Pray for us to God, alleluia.
Rejoice and be glad, O Virgin Mary, alleluia.
For the Lord has truly risen, alleluia.
la: Gaude et lætáre, Virgo María, allelúia.

la.description: Traditional Gregorian chant for Regina Caeli

en: Hail, Holy Queen
Hail, Holy Queen, Mother of Mercy,
our life, our sweetness and our hope.
To thee do we cry, poor banished children of Eve;
to thee do we send up our sighs,
mourning and weeping in this valley of tears.
Turn then, most gracious advocate,
thine eyes of mercy toward us;
and after this our exile,
show unto us the blessed fruit of thy womb, Jesus.
O clement, O loving, O sweet Virgin Mary.
la: vita, dulcedo, et spes nostra, salve.
Ad te clamamus exsules filii Evae,
ad te suspiramus, gementes et flentes
Eia, ergo, advocata nostra, illos tuos
et Jesum, benedictum fructum ventris tui,
O clemens, O pia, O dulcis Virgo Maria.
